intro: Eschweilera simplex, commonly known as the white-flowered zygocactus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom during the winter months. It is a popular houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements. Eschweilera simplex prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
